intro: Rodriguezia luteola, commonly known as the yellow Rodriguezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The fruit is a fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
